lenders.occupational_info: I am a trained EMT Instructor by rescue 911 USA and an EMT Assessor for Australasia (www.aremt.com click assess coord, Philippines) Im in the Philippines and have started emergency training services on my own. I have purchased some training manikins and other training materials. I need to loan so I could use it for 3 months rental find a decent place for an office and training area. As an Instructor trainer for ECSI -American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons, I have trained 6 Registered Nurses in the Philippines as my Staff Instructors. I want to help develop the EMS System in Cebu City. Please help me with my Project. see (www.ecsinstitute.org) click international skills center, Philippines)

lenders.loan_because:
My family was poor when I was a child, and through hard work, education and dedication I am now well off. I can attest that education is the answer to poverty. This is one of the greatest ideas that I have ever seen. By funding these people, they may in turn do well for themselves and be able to afford to give their children an education, thereby breaking the cycle of poverty.

Imagine if everyone who could in the world, gave just a small fraction of their income, or a few hours of their time to help others. Imagine what the world could be.

lenders.name: Zorre
lenders.loan_because: IIn 2004 zijn we gestart met restaurant Tacos, gefinancierd met een banklening. In arme landen is het vaak moeilijk of onmogelijk om een lening te krijgen. Huiseigendom is vaak niet gedocumenteerd, zodat dit niet als onderpand kan dienen. Einde aan armoede begint bij kleine startups, en niet zoals de overheid denkt, met giften aan arme landen. De beste manier om kleine bedrijven te stimuleren is door het makkelijker te maken geld te lenen. Niet door ze geld te geven! Gratis geld wordt nou eeenmaal niet goed besteed.  Kortom, als iedereen een paar euro wegzet om uit te lenen zal de welvaart stijgen in die arme landen. Het mooie is, als een bedrijfje zijn lening heeft betaald, kan je het geld hergebruiken om nog meer bedrijven te steunen!

lenders.occupational_info: I am single parent and I see how difficult is to find kindergarten in Moscow. Many people are living here. So I have expirience of working with kinds and want to help parents and kids by basing the kindergarten. I already bought some materials. So I will appriciate your help with money for renting place.

Loc

lenders.loan_because: People know best how to help themselves. International aid organizations can do some good in times of dire emergency, but often are hindered by misplaced resources, administrative costs, and politics. Real, long term sustainable development is more likely come from small community entities with local knowledge and accountability to themselves and their supporters.
lenders.occupational_info: I help communities create large site-specific pageants and processions. Working in close  collaboration with local residents, I create original festival events – using giant puppets, masks and costumes, and mobile architecture – that celebrate and preserve local narratives, myths, and everyday histories.

lenders.name: Kim & Hayden
lenders.loan_because:
I think it's important to give a hand up, particularly to other women (and other parents), whenever we can. It's only by sheer, dumb luck that my family was born where we were and have had some of the opportunities that we have. It's our responsibility to share that good fortune as much as we can.

For the past six years, my daughter, Hayden, has helped me choose who we loan money to. She favours mums with kids in primary school and shorter loan terms, so we can relend faster (smart kid!). She is developing a social conscience at a very early age!
lenders.occupational_info: I work in corporate sponsorship. I assist companies to make good decisions about how to spend their money. I also write books and teach companies how to spend their sponsorship money wisely, as well as teaching organisations how to raise money.

lenders.name: Aaron
lenders.loan_because: People like me living in the highest income countries have 86 percent of world Gross Domestic Product (GDP), 82 percent of world export markets, 68 percent of foreign direct investment and 74 percent of world telephone lines. Those living in the poorest countries share only one percent of any of these.

lenders.name: SHOUT factory

lenders.name: Village School Foundation
lenders.loan_because: As human beings we are constantly making choices every minute of every day either on a conscious or subconscious level.  With the choices that we make, comes the responsibility for accepting what we experience in life.  As children from poor villages of Viet Nam, did we choose poverty?  As inmates in the only maximum-security prison in Oregon, did we choose to be locked up?  In a world where children have no choices and where people made wrong choices collide, we’re here to keep hope alive.  We want to share with KIVA that with a little bit of hope the world can be a better place.  In prison we maybe – but imprisoned we are not.

lenders.name: Entrepreneurs 121
lenders.loan_because: Kids CAN Change The  World!!!
lenders.occupational_info:
ADEN FOREVER 
We are middle school students at St. Lawrence School  near Montreal, Quebec. KIVA is our project which was begun to honour the memory of a young boy called ADEN ROACH who passed away several years ago at the age of 8 years old. Aden was a particularly good-hearted little boy, so we decided that KIVA was a good way to honour his memory.
We blog about KIVA and other things at:
http://allthingsquebec.wordpress.com/

If you're a teacher you may also be interested in my lesson plans . at:
www.kivapedia.org/index.php/Main_Page/Education


Evelyn Yvonne Theriault
